channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-10952] [REST] Let the user turn off block caching if desired
item.description: After HBASE-10884 the REST gateway will use scanner defaults with respect to block caching. Add support for a query parameter for hinting blocks for the query should not be cached. Enable block caching by default.
item.summary: [REST] Let the user turn off block caching if desired

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Patch soon.

Ping stack and Lars Hofhansl, companion issue to HBASE-10884.
Attached patch introduces a new query parameter and field to the Scanner model in a backwards compatible way.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12639622/HBASE-10952.patch
against trunk revision .
ATTACHMENT ID: 12639622

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 8 new or modified tests.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

-1 findbugs. The patch appears to introduce 1 new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

-1 lineLengths. The patch introduces the following lines longer than 100:
+ * @param value true if HFile blocks should be cached on the servers for this scan, false otherwise
+ new java.lang.String[]

{ "StartRow", "EndRow", "Columns", "Batch", "StartTime", "EndTime", "MaxVersions", "Filter", "Caching", "Labels", "CacheBlocks", }

);

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/9251//testReport/
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/9251//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-hadoop2-compat.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/9251//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-prefix-tree.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/9251//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-client.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/9251//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-common.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/9251//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-protocol.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/9251//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-server.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/9251//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-examples.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/9251//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-thrift.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/9251//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-hadoop-compat.html
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/9251//console

This message is automatically generated.
'nocache' doesn't make sense for 0.94 so skip that version, see https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/EditComment!default.jspa?id=12705867&commentId=13966090
Same comment as over in HBASE-10884 [~andrew.purtellAndrew Purtell

+1 from me.

(cc Vandana Ayyalasomayajula, Francis Liu)
